poem:
Title: "The Songstress on Paper"

She wakes, a light thief of slumber,
Voice like a bee, notes her nectar.
Winsome yet worn, her melody trod,
Yet, distinctly hers, Brighton's proud songbird.
In echoes of Del Rey, she dallies,
With precision of Jacklin, she rallies.
Note by note, her story unfurls,
A songstress painting a listening world.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Bess Atwell: Light Sleeper review – poignant, dreamlike miniatures Bess Atwell has the kind of voice that lands on notes like a pollinator on a pistil: lightly, but with singular purpose. The winsome female singer-songwriter is an overplayed trope, but Brighton-based Atwell – on her third album – manages to combine the hazy languor endemic to the Lana Del Rey era with the left-field precision of Julia Jacklin, creating a body of songs that transcends". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Bess Atwell: Light Sleeper review – poignant, dreamlike miniatures Bess Atwell has the kind of voice that lands on notes like a pollinator on a pistil: lightly, but with singular purpose.
